title: Comprehensive Cardiovascular Assessment Initiated
summary: Dr. Warren recommended a full diagnostic panel, including advanced lipid tests like ApoB and Lp(a).
rationale: To get a clear, evidence-based baseline of Rohan's cardiovascular risk, prompted by his urgent request due to his family's history of heart disease.

title: Initial Health Protocol Deployed
summary: Carla introduced a nutrition plan to lower ApoB; Rachel provided a foundational exercise plan to manage blood pressure.
rationale: The initial diagnostic results showed elevated ApoB (125 mg/dL) and borderline high blood pressure (135/85 mmHg), which needed to be addressed directly.

title: Plan Adapted for Travel & Lifestyle
summary: In response to feedback, Neel de-escalated the issue, and the team provided a flexible travel dining guide and a hotel room workout.
rationale: Rohan reported that the initial plan was unsustainable with his work and travel schedule, creating a significant friction point that needed to be resolved for long-term adherence.

title: Precision Pivot to CGM Monitoring
summary: After 3-month tests showed stubbornly high ApoB, Carla recommended a Continuous Glucose Monitor (CGM) to gather more precise, real-time metabolic data.
rationale: The 3-month follow-up data showed the general nutrition plan was not effective enough for Rohan's specific physiology, requiring a more personalized, data-driven approach to lower his ApoB.

title: Key Insight: Oatmeal Glucose Spike
summary: Rohan's new CGM data revealed a massive glucose spike after eating oatmeal, a food he previously considered to be a healthy choice.
rationale: The real-time data proved that Rohan's body has a poor glycemic response to that specific breakfast, leading to an immediate, evidence-based change in his nutrition plan to better control metabolic stress.

title: Stress Resilience Protocol Deployed
summary: The team proactively scheduled 'cognitive reset' breaks and dynamically adjusted his training plan to focus on recovery during a high-stress work period.
rationale: To mitigate the negative physiological impact of intense work stress and support Rohan's primary goal of enhancing cognitive performance and stamina under pressure.

title: Performance Baseline Established (VO₂max & DEXA)
summary: To shift the program focus to performance optimization, Advik recommended and Ruby scheduled VO₂max and DEXA scans for Rohan.
rationale: With Rohan's core biomarkers stabilized, the next logical step was to establish new, advanced baselines for longevity and performance metrics that Rohan personally cares about.

title: Successful 6-Month Review & Pivot to Longevity
summary: The 6-month lab results showed excellent results, with ApoB dropping to the optimal range (85 mg/dL). Neel framed this as a graduation to the 'longevity' phase of the program.
rationale: The primary health risks identified at the start had been successfully managed, validating the program's effectiveness and allowing the strategy to evolve towards more proactive, long-term health goals.

title: Proactive Screening: Full-Body MRI Scheduled
summary: Building on the new longevity focus, Rohan proactively requested and the team endorsed scheduling a full-body MRI for early cancer detection.
rationale: This decision directly aligns with Rohan's long-term goal of implementing annual, comprehensive health screenings for proactive disease prevention and management.

title: New Longevity Goal: Building Cognitive Reserve
summary: Rohan proactively identified learning a new complex skill (piano) as a way to build cognitive reserve, which Neel fully endorsed and integrated into his Pillar 5 plan.
rationale: To further support his goal of enhancing cognitive function, Rohan shifted his focus to a new, evidence-based method for promoting neuroplasticity and long-term brain health.
